author: SpunkyAmbassador

defaultParameters.description: Enter 1 to return only the achieved trophies for a user. Enter 0 to return only trophies the user hasn't achieved. Enter -1 to retrieve all trophies.
defaultParameters.name: getTrophies

defaultParameters.description: If you would like to return just one trophy, you may pass the trophy ID with this parameter. If you do, only that trophy will be returned in the response. You may also pass multiple trophy IDs here if you want to return a subset of all the trophies. You do this as a comma-separated list, use string as default value and enter comma-separated list as value. Passing a trophy_id will ignore the getTrophies parameter if it is passed. Leave trophy_id as -1 to ignore this parameter.
defaultParameters.name: trophy_id

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store response value of success.
defaultParameters.name: successVariableID

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store data return by Game Jolt. The data will get store as a JSON object.
defaultParameters.name: returnDataStoreVariableID

defaultParameters.description: If Switch:ON then logs return data in console. If Switch:OFF then does not logs data in console
defaultParameters.name: consoleLog

commands.description: Returns one trophy or multiple trophies, depending on the parameters passed in.
commands.name: Trophies - Fetch

defaultParameters.description: The ID of the trophy to add for the user. [Required]
defaultParameters.name: trophy_id

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store response data. Use -1 if you don't want to store data.
defaultParameters.name: successVariableID

commands.description: Sets a trophy as achieved for a particular user.
commands.name: Trophies - Add Achieved

defaultParameters.description: The ID of the trophy to remove from the user. [Required]
defaultParameters.name: trophy_id

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store the data of success.
defaultParameters.name: successVariableID

commands.description: Remove a previously achieved trophy for a particular user.
commands.name: Trophies - Remove Achieved

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store data of whether the request succeeded or failed.
defaultParameters.name: successVariableID

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store data of return message. If the request was not successful, this contains the error message.
defaultParameters.name: messageVariableID

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store data of return message. This variable will store the UNIX time stamp (in seconds) representing the server's time.
defaultParameters.name: timestampVariableID

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store the timezone of the server.
defaultParameters.name: timezoneVariableID

defaultParameters.description: Id of variable to store current year.
defaultParameters.name: yearVariableID

defaultParameters.description: Id of variable to store current month.
defaultParameters.name: monthVariableID

defaultParameters.description: Id of variable to store current day.
defaultParameters.name: dayVariableID

defaultParameters.description: Id of variable to store current hour.
defaultParameters.name: hourVariableID

defaultParameters.description: Id of variable to store current minute.
defaultParameters.name: minuteVariableID

defaultParameters.description: Id of variable to store current second.
defaultParameters.name: secondVariableID

commands.description: Returns the time of the Game Jolt server.
commands.name: Time - Time Fetch

defaultParameters.description: This is a string value associated with the score.
defaultParameters.name: score

defaultParameters.description: This is a numerical sorting value associated with the score. All sorting will be based on this number.
defaultParameters.name: sort

defaultParameters.description: If there's any extra data you would like to store as a string, you can use this variable.
defaultParameters.name: extra_data

defaultParameters.description: The ID of the score table to submit to. If table_id is left -1, the score will be submitted to the primary high score table.
defaultParameters.name: table_id

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store success of request.
defaultParameters.name: successVariableID

commands.description: Adds a score for a user. (Guest accounts are not supported yet)
commands.name: Scores - Add

defaultParameters.description: The number of scores you'd like to return.
defaultParameters.name: limit

defaultParameters.description: The ID of the score table. If value is left at -1, the scores from the primary score table will be returned.
defaultParameters.name: table_id

defaultParameters.description: If Switch:ON then retrieve all scores.. If Switch:OFF then retrieve scores for just playing user.
defaultParameters.name: getGlobalScores

defaultParameters.description: Fetch only scores better than this score sort value. Use -1 to ignore this parameter.
defaultParameters.name: better_than

defaultParameters.description: Fetch only scores worse than this score sort value. Use -1 to ignore this parameter.
defaultParameters.name: worse_than

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store success of request.
defaultParameters.name: successVariableID

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store return data from server. The return data will be a JSON array stored as string in the variable.
defaultParameters.name: returnDataStoreVariableID

defaultParameters.description: If Switch:ON then logs return data in console. If Switch:OFF then does not logs data in console
defaultParameters.name: consoleLog

commands.description: Returns a list of scores either for a user or globally for a game.
commands.name: Scores - Fetch

defaultParameters.description: This is a numerical sorting value that is represented by a rank on the score table.
defaultParameters.name: sort

defaultParameters.description: The ID of the score table from which you want to get the rank. Remark - If value is left -1, the ranks from the primary high score table will be returned.
defaultParameters.name: table_id

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store success of request.
defaultParameters.name: successVariableID

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store the rank of the score on the score table.
defaultParameters.name: rankVariableID

commands.description: Returns the rank of a particular score on a score table. Remark - If the score is not represented by any rank on the score table, the request will return the rank that is closest to the requested score.
commands.name: Scores - Get Rank

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store success of request.
defaultParameters.name: successVariableID

defaultParameters.description: ID of variable to store return data from server. The return data will be a JSON array stored as string in the variable.
defaultParameters.name: returnDataStoreVariableID

defaultParameters.description: If Switch:ON then logs return data in console. If Switch:OFF then does not logs data in console
defaultParameters.name: consoleLog

commands.description: Returns a list of high score tables for a game.
commands.name: Scores - Tables

defaultParameters.description: ID of your Game Jolt game
defaultParameters.name: Game ID

defaultParameters.description: API Key of your game. You can find it under your game dashboard > Game API > API Setings > Private Key
defaultParameters.name: API Key

description:
This is Game Jolt API Plugin for RPG Paper Maker. Using this plugin you can interact with Game Jolt API.

Using this plugin, you can:
- give achivements to your players.
- get current time by sending request to Game Jolt Servers.
- add and get scores of players.

Currently, this plugin supports:
- Trophies
- Time
- Scores

This API is currently in development and new features are getting added regularly.

NOTE:
- There are many values you can store in variables. To store values in variables, enter the respected variable ID for the values. If you wish to not store values in variables, enter -1 in value field and the data will not get stored.
- Some parameters have additional information about -1 default value, make sure to properly read description of each parameters.
name: Game Jolt API

parameters.description: ID of your Game Jolt game
parameters.name: Game ID

parameters.description: API Key of your game. You can find it under your game dashboard > Game API > API Setings > Private Key
parameters.name: API Key
